entries.title: The GOP’s redistricting push in Texas hinges on newly-red Hispanic voters continuing to vote Republican. But there are signs that their support for the Trump agenda has faded.
A Georgia-based reporter has sued the Trump administration over his monthslong detention, alleging he has been targeted for his reporting on immigration-enforcement actions
Meet the Democrat who says that a craving for an orderly society—controlling crime, homelessness and cost of living—will decide elections
President Trump has ordered the Pentagon to send three Navy warships to interdict drug cartels off the coast of South America, including near Venezuela
A federal judge on Wednesday denied the Justice Department’s request to unseal grand jury materials from its case against Jeffrey Epstein
Billionaire Bill Ackman has a new fascination: a private school that eschews lessons on diversity, equity and inclusion and uses AI to speed-teach children in two hours
The Trump administration is planning to screen immigrants for ‘anti-American’ views
Billionaire Elon Musk is quietly pumping the brakes on his plans to start a political party, according to people with knowledge of his plans
A Republican-led House committee said it plans to publicly release some files it receives from the Justice Department related to Jeffrey Epstein
The Trump administration has restored a website that tracks federal spending, in a victory for lawmakers who said the White House was using the blackout to freeze funding without public disclosures
An ousted DOJ official says Bondi aides corrupted antitrust enforcement
Former Sen. Sherrod Brown (D., Ohio) has launched a comeback bid
Georgia’s Republican Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger has survived attacks from Donald Trump and a shunning by the GOP to re-emerge as a contender in Georgia politics.
Trump’s federal takeover of DC police is unprecedented and its implementation remains unclear
Detroit’s mayor says he can’t be a Democrat any longer and is instead trying to prove Elon Musk’s suggestion that America needs another option to the two major parties
Like Zohran Mamdani in New York, the rise of Minneapolis mayoral candidate Omar Fateh highlights the Democratic Party’s diverging centrist establishment and progressive wing
More National Guard troops are heading soon to Washington, D.C., and they are preparing to start carrying weapons in the coming days, officials say, a shift in policy
President Trump, by meeting Vladimir Putin on Friday, is hoping to forge in person what he hasn’t been able to accomplish by phone—a partnership with the Kremlin leader to end the war in Ukraine
The Trump administration’s decision to charge Nvidia and AMD a portion of the sales from their AI chips to China opens up legal and national-security concerns. Here’s what to know.
William H. Webster, a former FBI and CIA chief who helped restore confidence in both agencies after scandals of the ’70s and ’80s, has died at the age of 101
President Trump has directed the Pentagon to begin preparing options to use military force against Latin American drug cartels, the latest step in the administration’s campaign against the cartels
